strings.string: Using equipment does not cancel reload
Returns missed bullets to the ammo pool
While you were away, your settlers collected
Don't worry, we've all been there.
Guess you need a better gaming chair.
Try using more gun next time.
Next time will be the one.
Go ahead and jump off to continue.
I can hear them when I try to sleep. The constant scratching...
Glad to see you're back safe.
Can I get some of your hair? For observation...
Do you think they feel anything?
Maybe I should training one of them...
All things considered, this is going pretty well.
I wish I could be of more help.
Hey, I'm a bit occupied with research.
This is fascinating, I've never seen a cellular response like this.
Hey there, I'm a former combat medic.
My girlfriend was on vacation. I hope she's ok.
Funny story, I used to be afraid of needles.
Is there a face under there?
I'll be real, I'm pretty bored.
You ever read Asimov? I love sci-fi.
You can see so many stars at night here.
I hope someone is documenting all this.
I wish I had some more books.
I did 3 tours. I should've stopped at 2.
Keeping everyone healthy is my priority.
After my discharge, I mostly did volunteer work.
Days like these, all you can do is ask why.
I'm sick of patching people up.
Stay out of my medicine cabinet.
I used to treat addicts. What's yours?
Med school did not prepare me for this...
I'm not sure how you're still standing.
When did you last check your temperature?
My sutures are the stuff of legends.
Blood type? No, I meant your favorite type.
In another life, I'd be a brewmaster.
Scars tell stories, you're a bloody novel.
Never thought I'd miss the smell of hospital antiseptic.
You're on a first name basis with pain, aren't you?
I was almost a pro bowler once.
I've done my share of crying.
I'm a sucker for dumb jokes. Got any?
Used to treat gunshot wounds. Now I treat... whatever this is.
These hands have saved lives. And they've taken them too.
Would kill for a good cup of coffee.
The human body is a fascinating mess.
Ever think about the afterlife? Me neither.
Used to write poetry. Now I write prescriptions.
You're going to owe me a drink after this.
These are the times that try men's souls...and bodies.
I'm not a therapist, but you sure need one.
What doesn't kill you...well, I'm here to make sure it doesn't.
I patch you up, you come back broken. Vicious cycle.
Shh... Don't tell anyone. I prefer dogs to humans.
You look like you've been chewed up and spit out.
Ever been to a clown convention? It's less crazy than this.
Survival of the fittest? We're about to find out.
I miss the comfort of paperwork.
War zone or emergency room? Hard to tell these days.
You're going to put me out of business at this rate.
Your health insurance probably doesn't cover... this.
Ever hear the one about the doctor and the skeleton?
Fighting hurts, but boredom can kill too.
If you listen carefully, you can hear your body screaming.
Don't worry, I've patched up stranger things.
If I had a nickel for every bullet wound I've treated...
Who's your next of kin? Just in case...
Do you bleed? Let's find out.
You know, even doctors need doctors.
Is there a doctor in the house? Oh right, it's me.
Look at it this way, at least you're not dead...yet.
What's up, doc? Oh, sorry, I always wanted to say that.
Let's play a game. It's called 'Stay Alive'.
I wonder how much a human body is worth these days...
Fun fact: Did you know the human body has 206 bones? You're down to 205...
I could use a drink. Or five.
Laughing is the best medicine. After whatever I'm giving you, of course.
Death is just life's way of telling you to slow down.
If I had a penny for every near-death experience...
A moment on the lips, forever on the hips...and bullets, well they just rip through everything.
My medical advice? Stop getting shot.
Laughter is the best medicine, but I think you need something stronger.
Are you sure you're not a punching bag?
If I had a dime for every time I've seen that wound...
Death is the poor man's doctor. Lucky for you, I'm rich in experience.
You're not dying on my watch. That's too much paperwork.
I used to be a pacifist. Look where that got me.
Guns don't kill people... but they sure help.
Looking for something with a little more kick?
Stick around. I'm sure we can find something to your liking.
Penny for your thoughts, bullet for your enemy.
Ever hear the phrase 'armed to the teeth'? I take it literally.
Remember, an empty gun is just a paperweight.
Big or small, I got 'em all.
You can never have too many bullets.
The only safety here is the one on your gun.
First rule of gun safety: Don't point it at anything you're not willing to destroy.
You can never be too armed in this world.
Got a light? Oh, wait... that's my laser sight.
Here's a tip: Aim for the head.
Peace through superior firepower. That's my motto.
I've got the right to bear arms, and sell them too.
Guns don't come with a safety manual. They come with a 'don't die' manual.
You know what they say about bringing a knife to a gun fight.
That's not a gun in my pocket... oh wait, it is.
Don't worry, I've got your caliber.
My guns might be second-hand, but they still pack a punch.
Ammo's on the house... Just kidding.
My philosophy? Shoot first, shoot later, shoot some more and then when everyone's dead try to ask a question or two.
Trust me, the bigger the gun, the smaller the... well, you get the idea.
You can talk the talk, but can you shoot the shoot?
In my world, the early bird gets the gun.
Running low? I can help with that.
Keep your friends close and your guns closer.
Ever danced with the devil? It's easier with a shotgun.
Remember, it's all fun and games until someone loses a bullet.
Life is a highway, and I'm the roadside bomb.
In the right hands, a pen can be mightier than a sword. But why risk it?
I don't usually do discounts. But for you? Full price.
They say talk is cheap. So are bullets. Choose wisely.
If you've got a problem, I've got a caliber for it.
Guns make the world go round... or stop, depending on where you point 'em.
If you can't hit your target, you're either drunk or not carrying one of my guns.
I've got a bullet with your name on it... Wait, that didn't come out right.
Pull the pin, count to three... Oops, wrong order.
I got something that'll put a hole in your problems.
Iron sights, red sights, dead sights.
Bang bang, my baby shot me down.
I'll take care of your bang for your buck.
They don't call me a gun-slinger for nothing.
One shot, one kill. Any questions?
All's fair in love and gun trade.
Remember, an armed society is a polite society.
My favorite symphony? The sound of gunfire.
No refunds if you shoot your foot off.
Two in the chest, one in the head. Easy.
Ever tried shooting your problems away? It's effective.
Hold your friends close, your enemies closer, and your gun closest.
I'm the Wall mart of warfare.
Here, bullets are the only currency.
Guns don't kill people. Lack of ammo does.
Everything in life has a cost. Yours is a bullet.
High caliber? I have the highest.
Guns and roses, but mostly guns.
You're going to love the 'kick' on this one.
I've got just the cure for your itchy trigger finger.
Looking for a pea shooter or a cannon?
Any closer and I'll have to start charging rent.
I bet you can't carry all these.
Remember, it's not the size of the gun...
How about a nice, quiet knife?
I've got the 'boom' that makes bad guys 'kaboom'.
Reloading is for people with too much time.
Accuracy by volume, that's my motto.
Guns: because fistfights are for cowards.
Guns are like potato chips, you can't have just one.
Just keep them pointed that way, okay?
Oh, I've got something special for you.
Ever held a firearm so beautiful you wept?
Sold my soul for this collection.
Remember: aim for the soft parts.
Looking for a magic wand? Get a shotgun.
Keep calm and carry a big gun.
Buying a gun is like buying safety.
Looking for a silencer? Having neighbor problems?
Sawed-off? For when you need to make a loud point.
Don't die out there, I don't do refunds.
Ever notice how folks are polite at the gun shop?
Trouble comes uninvited. Best be prepared.
I can arm a small army. You interested?
Ask me about our group discount!
You know what's better than a gun? More guns.
I got a cure for living: it's called bullets.
Got a bone to pick? Try lead.
Don't point that at your face, rookie.
Why do I always get the trigger-happy customers?
Ever see a gun say its prayers? You might here.
See a safety switch? Yeah, me neither.
I sell ammo! And yes, it's overpriced.
This is a bullet. I also sell these. How convenient!
I hear empty wallets make for empty magazines.
Bullets or beans, they both cost money. Guess which one keeps you alive longer.
Show me the money, then I'll show you the ammo.
No ammo, no pew pew. No money, no ammo.
Can't eat bullets, but you can't eat without them either.
I'm the lord of lead, the duke of destruction, the prince of projectiles.
You pay in lead? No? Shame, I have a lot of it.
Everyone's after a quick buck. Mine's just quicker than most.
Money can't buy happiness, but it can buy ammo. Same thing, right?
Bring cash, leave with brass. It's a simple exchange.
Don't you love the smell of fresh casings? And fresh money.
Let me check my list... Yep, still only accepting money.
What's green and smells like ammo? My wallet.
I can't hear you over the sound of coins jingling.
Why can't bullets be free? Because my yacht isn't.
It's not about the money... wait, yes it is.
Why do bullets whistle? They're just excited to empty your pockets.
There are two types of people. Those who buy ammo, and easy pickings.
Got any spare change? I've got spare shells.
They say money is the root of all evil. Guess that makes me the devil.
I'm a simple merchant. I see money, I sell ammo.
Keep your friends close and your money closer.
Bullets are just angry little coins, right?
Money may not grow on trees, but it does buy ammo.
Ammo today, more money tomorrow. It's the circle of life!
I'm not greedy, I'm just... extremely enthusiastic about money.
Ammo. Cash only. No, I won't barter for your socks.
Your gun's appetite for ammo is only outmatched by my appetite for money.
The only safety I care about is financial security.
Money is the best armor. And I'm heavily armored.
In this world, cash is king and I'm the king's treasurer.
Ah, the sweet sound of coins clinking. Better than any gunshot.
Sure, take your time deciding. My yacht isn't going to buy itself.
Money can't buy you love, but it can buy you plenty of ammo.
Pay now or pay later. It's always about the pay.
I accept two forms of payment: cash, and more cash.
Ran out of bullets? Well, I'm running out of patience. Pay up.
Welcome to my empire of ammunition. Payment up front.
Cash, credit, orâ€¦ just kidding. Cash only.
Got some special deals... for special prices.
Why do I sell ammo? Same reason you buy it. Survival.
I do have a heart, it's just made of gold.
Just think of me as your friendly, neighborhood, incredibly greedy ammo dealer.
Need ammo? Need money. See how that works?
If you can't afford ammo, you probably can't afford to live here.
Only thing that makes a louder bang than my ammo is my cash register.
Trust me, I'm worth every penny. And so is my ammo.
You know what they say, time is money. And I'm wasting both talking to you.
You look like someone who appreciates the value of a dollar... and a bullet.
Sure, the world's gone to hell, but on the bright side, business is booming.
I know, I know, my prices are criminal. What are you gonna do, call the cops?
I sell bullets. They're like tiny, deadly fundraisers for my retirement.
You know what they say, "If it's too expensive, you're too poor."
You can't put a price on life. But you can on ammo. Weird, huh?
Pew, pew, pay, pay. It's the rhythm of life.
You're not paying for the ammo. You're paying for my exquisite taste.
I'm not in the ammo business. I'm in the money business.
Without ammo, you'll be nothing more than a snack for... whatever's out there.
Those things out there sure love a fresh target. Keep loaded.
Don't skimp on ammo. It's the difference between hunter and hunted.
Bullets aren't just metal and powder. They're your ticket to tomorrow.
I'm not saying those things out there are waiting for you to run out of bullets, but...
Scared of the night? A full magazine can be pretty comforting.
You ever notice how those things get twitchy when they hear a gun click empty?
When your clip runs dry, that's when the real fun starts... for them.
If you can't afford bullets, I'd recommend running. Fast.
Ever wondered what it feels like to be chased without any ammo? Me neither.
Ammo: because "I ran out of bullets" is a terrible last word.
I sell peace of mind. And by that, I mean bullets.
I hear it's hard to count your money when you're running for your life. Better stock up.
Nothing says "not today" like a fully-loaded firearm.
It's a crazy world out there. And the crazy ones pay the best.
If you've got money, I've got ammo. If you've got neither, well... good luck.
I know it's pricey, but you'll thank me when you're not dinner for... well, you know.
Sure, you could save your money. But I don't think they accept cash.
You look like you could use more ammo. And I could use more money. Win-win.
The price of ammo goes up every time someone becomes... unavailable. Supply and demand.
Empty pockets won't save you out there. Neither will an empty gun.
You know what's more expensive than bullets? Becoming one of those things.
I'm in the survival business. You give me money, I help you survive.
Those things out there? They're not interested in your money. But I am.
If you're feeling brave, I've got some 'lightly used' ammo for half the price.
I do a roaring trade around full moons. Coincidence?
You can't bargain with them. But with me? Everything's negotiable. For a price.
A good deal for you, a better deal for me.
With my prices, you'd think bullets grow on trees. And hey, maybe they do in this crazy world.
I don't just sell ammo. I sell the chance to live another day.
The only currency those things understand is lead. And I've got plenty.
Sure, I charge a lot. But can you really put a price on not getting eaten?
You want to haggle? Okay, double the price and we'll start from there.
You can always try fighting them off with harsh language. Let me know how that goes.
One bullet could save your life. Or it could make me rich. Let's find out.
This isn't charity. It's survival. So, cash or card?
Listen, I don't make the prices. I just enjoy them.
Bargain hunters die quick around here. Just saying.
Trust me, you'll miss these prices when you're out there without a bullet to your name.
Your money or your life? Just kidding. I'll take both.
Need something to liven up the party? You've come to the right place!
Grenades: because sometimes subtlety is overrated.
Claymores? For when you really, really don't want visitors.
Bear traps aren't just for bears anymore, friend.
Kunai: For the discerning ninja in all of us.
Explosions are an art form, my friend.
There's no thrill like a close call.
Living on the edge? My favorite spot.
Ever tried juggling live grenades? Don't.
Safety is for the dull and boring.
I've got a knack for dramatic entrances.
Let's turn those frowns into fireballs!
One man's accident is another man's spectacle.
Who needs a safety net when you can have fireworks?
Loud noises and bright lights, what's not to love?
If you ain't living dangerously, you ain't living.
Why solve problems when you can blow them up?
A thrill a day keeps the doctor away.
You know what they say about playing with fire...
Don't worry about the noise. It's just the sound of fun.
My motto? Light the fuse and run like hell.
Boredom is the real danger, am I right?
If it's not potentially lethal, it's not my style.
Risk is just the price of excitement.
Why tiptoe through life to arrive safely at death?
Ever tried skydiving? No parachute, just style.
When I was a stunt double, I set myself on fire. Great times!
Was a bomb defusal expert. Retired after one too many 'booms'.
Ever invent a new firework? Call it, 'the party ender'.
Drove a motorcycle off a cliff once, just for the thrill of it.
Life's about the bangs, booms, and kabooms. Wouldn't you agree?
My last job was a minefield tester. I was excellent, until...
Used to be an EOD tech. Let's just say I have a unique touch.
My parents wanted a quiet life. I... disagreed.
You know how they say "Don't try this at home"? I never listened.
Why play it safe when you can play with fire?
Tried bungee jumping once. Forgot the bungee.
Base jumping? Done it. Free climbing? Been there. Fire eating? My breakfast.
My mom always said I'd lose a finger. She was half right.
Why have a plan when you can have an explosion?
You know how some folks collect stamps? I collect near-death experiences.
I've got the thrill gene. It's like the chill gene, but with more screaming.
When I was a kid, my sandbox was a minefield. Gave new meaning to 'playtime'.
I don't look for trouble, but when it finds me, I like to make a bang.
I was the kid who set off the fireworks at the wrong time. And I loved it.
Everyone's a pyro, some of us are just more honest about it.
If you're gonna go out, go out with a bang.
I've got a date with danger. And I think she likes me.
Ever see a quiet riot? Neither have I.
In this line of work, you gotta love the smell of gunpowder.
Have you ever danced with mayhem in the pale moonlight?
My last pet? A bomb-sniffing dog. Long story.
Why have a nightlight when you can have dynamite?
Ever tried to surf on an explosion? I have the scars to prove it.
I hear whispers in the wind, they say "boom".
Some see a wasteland. I see a playground.
Quiet nights bore me. Craving some noise?
Ever wanted to be a firework? Me, I've been one.
You know the rule of thumb with grenades, right? I lost mine learning it.
I've been to the other side. It wasn't loud enough.
Silence is golden, but I prefer the ringing in my ears.
Let's liven up this ghost town, shall we?
I've danced on the edge. The view is spectacular.
You ever play hot potato with a live grenade? Talk about a party game.
Got a light? I usually use a fuse.
Ever try to juggle live mines? It's all about the timing.
Death defying? That's my middle name.
In the symphony of destruction, I'm the conductor.
Ever try to out-run an explosion? I have the high score.
I don't fear the reaper, I just show him a good time.
Noise complaint? Music to my ears.
Have you ever seen a sunrise with a mushroom cloud? Breathtaking.
Looking to make some noise? You're in the right place.
Ever high five a shockwave? Exhilarating.
I've danced with danger, and she's a great partner.
There's no problem a good explosion can't solve.
Ever play Russian Roulette with a fully loaded gun? That's a rush.
I used to play with matches. Now, I play with fuses.
Do you hear the call of chaos too?
Got any plans tonight? I'm thinking fireworks.
Can you hear that? It's the sound of impending doom. Exciting, isn't it?
In this quiet, I can hear the fuse burning.
I've made peace with the reaper. We're on a first name basis.
Some say I have a death wish. I say I have a thrill wish.
Wanna play a game of catch? I've got the perfect toy.
I love the smell of napalm in the morning.
Are you a risk taker? You're gonna love what I have in stock.
Life's short. Might as well make it spectacular.
Are you ready for some fireworks?
If life gives you lemons, use them as a grenade pin.
Some hear an explosion and think destruction. I hear art.
You ever wonder what your life would look like in slow motion?
If you're not living on the edge, you're taking up too much space.
I've kissed the sky. Got a bit of a burn on that one.
There's nothing like the sound of a fuse burning down.
If it's peace and quiet you want, I'm afraid I can't help.
When things get too quiet, I like to add a bit of bang.
All things considered, I'm just glad to be alive.
At least the traffic is better, eh?
Dude, I totally called this whole zombie apocalypse thing.
I hope my kids are safe.
Always good to meet new people.
You ever wonder if this whole thing is a simulation?
Why are you hiding your face?
Can you even see out of that hoodie?
Assuming those shots I heard earlier was you?
This is not how I expected to die.
Uhh, I think you have some brains on your bandana.
I could kill for a warm bath.
It haunts me everyday that I hung up.
What I wouldn't give to see their face again.
On the brightside, I have enough time to read now.
This is all just a test...
At least it wasn't nukes, I guess?
I'm telling you, Cthulu is responsible.
I'm a sucker for medieval castles.
Do you think we'll get through this?
I could use a cup of strong coffee.
I wish I knew how to handle a weapon that well.
I mean, at least we're still alive... right?
I feel like I haven't slept in 28 days.
This whole thing feels rather... contrived.
"I'll be fine, don't worry" he said.
Do you remember when this all started?
I'm just glad to be in here.
Dude... you might want to shower.
Could you find me some jelly beans?
Patrolling out here almost makes me...
And they say war never changes.
I can hear them in my sleep.
You think the doc's plan will work?
If this plan works, I'll be amazed.
Maybe you're like the chosen one or something.
I miss my guitar more than anything.
Times like these make you wonder.
Hard to get any sleep out here.
That doctor is kind of a shifty fellow.
So, what was your job in the previous world?
Do you think a frying pan would stop a bullet?
Do you have a vendetta against doors?
I wonder how many bullets you've shot.
I used to be a pro athlete you know.
I know words, I have the best words.
I hope this place is structurally sound.
I think I'm coming down with something.
I bet you can't do a backflip.
I heard some weird stuff last night.
When was the last time you slept?
I think I hiked here once.
What do you think it's like overseas?
The good news is I don't have work tommorow.
How do you think this all happened?
I'm glad I'm on your side.
Yo, what if this thing was an inside job?
So like, are we calling them zombies or not?
I don't know how I'm still breathing.
Hey, I won't question your methods.
You got a deck of cards?
Could you find me some peanut butter?
I hope we'll see a new day.
Good to see a familiar face.
I wish I had a radio.
I used to work around here.
What's the weather like out there?
Have you seen any other survivors?
I never thought I'd live to see this.
I can't remember the last meal I had.
Where did you learn to fight like that?
We need to find a way out.
Ever think about what you'll do when this is over?
I can't believe it's come to this.
Haven't had a decent cup of coffee in months.
I hope my family is safe.
I heard there's a safe zone to the north.
I had a dream about green fields last night.
Do you think there's a way to reverse all this?
There's got to be a cure, right?
I used to be a teacher.
I saw something moving in the shadows.
Never thought I'd be fighting for my life every day.
Is this real or am I dreaming?
I think we should move out at dawn.
I could use a good laugh.
How do you stay so calm?
I never got to say goodbye...
We need more watchmen at night.
I feel like we're being watched.
I could kill for a candy bar right now.
I don't know if I can take much more of this.
I've been alone for a long time.
I used to love the sunrise...
Hold on to hope, it's all we got.
Birds have been riled up lately.
I can't wait to get out of here!
I'm not here to fight, let me join.
Don't ask how I got here.
Watch where you point that thing!
I need somewhere to rest my head...
I've been stuck here for days.
I've been out here for months.
You're the first person I've seen in a while.
You're not here to hurt me?
You're not going to rob me?
Do you have a place to stay?
How did you make it here alive?
I'm finally getting out of here!
I'll see you at the colony.
Take them all out for me, alright?
Thanks, I was in a real pickle.
Yeah, think I'd rather stay with you.
I just want to be out of here.
I feel like I can finally breath again.
You showed up just in time!
Oh my god, I thought I was done for.
I thought I was the only one left.
I can't wait to meet the others!
We'll hold down the fort while you're gone.
Maybe you'll do better than the last guy?
Join my outpost he says, it's safe, he says.
I'm starting to regret signing up for this
Do you remember when this all started?
I'm just glad to be in here.
Dude... you might want to shower.
Could you find me some jelly beans?
Patrolling out here almost makes me...
And they say war never changes.
I can hear them in my sleep.
You think the doc's plan will work?
If this plan works, I'll be amazed.
Maybe you're like the chosen one or something.
I miss my guitar more than anything.
Times like these make you wonder.
Hard to get any sleep out here.
That doctor is kind of a shifty fellow.
So, what was your job in the previous world?
Do you think a frying pan would stop a bullet?
Do you have a vendetta against doors?
I wonder how many bullets you've shot.
I used to a pro athlete you know.
I know words, I have the best words.
I hope this place is structurally sound.
I think I'm coming down with something.
I bet you can't do a backflip.
I just love what you've done with the place.
I heard some weird stuff last night.
When was the last time you slept?
I think I hiked here once.
I'm glad to be out of the city.
What do you think it's like overseas?
The good news is I don't have work tommorow.
How do you think this all happened?
I'm glad I'm on your side.
There's no way this is going to work.
Bro, what if this thing was an inside job?
So like, are we calling them zombies or not?
I don't know how I'm still breathing.
Hey, I won't question your methods.
You got a deck of cards?
Do I look like a zombie?
How did you get in here!?
